channel.title: Reinstalling tomorrow
channel.description:
Currently I run Fedora 13 with an XP VM. Tomorrow I plan to install Ubuntu 10.10 and Windows Seven (for gaming), both on separate partitions.
I am currently copying the whole volume of my Fedora install onto the portable hard drive overnight and tomorrow I'll see to it.
I'm thinking:
[ul][li]150gb Ubuntu[/li] [li]100gb spare (fedora or something)[/li] [li]200gb Windows 7[/li] [li]500gb data[/li][/ul]
What filesystem should I use for the data partition? I would like it to be encrypted, but no so encrypted that when my computer breaks I cannot access the volume.
I have a portable hard drive, which probably won't be portable. When I start my studies though, I'd like it so when I plug it in (win7 and linux) it'll automagically copy the changed/added files onto the data partition, maybe even sync the important shit into my dropbox. I also need the portable hdd encrypted in case it's stolen.
Both of the drives are 1tb.
I'll be grateful if you could help me decide :)
